February 29, 1952
Mr. Seymour Siegel
WNYC
New York City, N.Y.
Dear Si:
Thank you for your latter of February 25 concerning the meeting
of the Board at Columbus. The first general session of the Institute
is at 8:00 P.M. on Thursday. Do you think that the NAEB Board can
complete all of the necessary business from 9*00 Thursday morning
until six that same day or should we ask the Board to meet Wednesday
evening with the Executive Committee meeting perhaps Wednesday at
2:00 P.M.?
Since several of the committee chairmen which you appointed at
the Gotham meeting are planning special sessions with their respective
committees coincidental with the Institute, would it not be wise to
communicate with these chairmen as soon as possible requesting that
they keep all day Thursday free for a full meeting of the Board and
perhaps designating Wednesday afternoon and Wednesday evening for
specific time for meeting of committees9 If we ask for a meeting of
the Board Thursday morning or Wedneday evening, can NAEB pay a portion
of the expenses that will be incurred?
Perhaps all of these are questions we can thrash out at the
Executive Committee meeting in Norman. However, the matter of a
specific meeting time of the Board should be set right away and members
of the Board notified of it so they will not arrange conflicting
committee meetings. If you agree with me on this, perhaps it would
be a good idea for you to write members of the Board setting up the
meeting date. If you prefer, I will write them but I don't want to
do so without your approval.
Thanks for getting the Morton matter straightened out. I think
Dallas has been a little pre-mature in his communications on the
subject but it is a good trait to have ideas formulated ai d get things
rolling. The boy is a fireball and will work well with Morton.
DIRECTOR OF STUDIES
DALLAS W. SMYTHE
